## Steps to reproduce

Start `pwsh.exe` and navigate to a path that includes a single quotation mark, then run the `Get-MpPreference` cmdlet twice.

Alternatively, copy and run:

```powershell
New-Item "$HOME\Desktop\quotation'error" -ItemType Directory | Out-Null
Set-Location "$HOME\Desktop\quotation'error"
Get-MpPreference
Get-MpPreference
Set-Location ..
Remove-Item "$HOME\Desktop\quotation'error" -Confirm
```

Note: The error will only occur on the initial call of the `Get-MpPreference` cmdlet, to reproduce it again you have to restart `pwsh.exe`.

## Expected behavior

`Get-MpPreference` runs twice.

## Actual behavior

`Get-MpPreference` throws an error on the initial call.

> The 'Get-MpPreference' command was found in the module 'ConfigDefender', but the module could not be loaded. For more information, run 'Import-Module ConfigDefender'.

From the second call on, the cmdlet runs fine.

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19042
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

## Additional info

- Works fine in PS5.1
- Works fine when location path doesn't contain a single quotation mark
- Error already present in 7.0.3
- Tested on my system and in a VM (both Win 10)
- Possible workaround:
  ```
  Get-MpPreference 2>&1>$null
  Get-MpPreference
  ```

comments.body:
Running `Import-Module ConfigDefender` will also throw an error on initial call if PWD contains a single quotation mark (and run fine afterwards):
```
WARNING: Module ConfigDefender is loaded in Windows PowerShell using WinPSCompatSession remoting session; please note that all input and output of commands from this module will be deserialized objects. If you want to load this module into PowerShell please use 'Import-Module -SkipEditionCheck' syntax.
Import-Module:
Line |
   1 |  Import-Module ConfigDefender
     |  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | The string is missing the terminator: '.
```
Note, that both commands run fine after one of them threw an error.

title: Get-MpPreference fails on initial call if current location path contains single quotation mark
